intro: Fracastora hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy fraxinella, is a perennial herb native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its hairy stems and leaves give it a distinctive appearance, and it often grows in dry, rocky soils. Fracastora hirsuta is known for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
